creator: dakshaau
title: PEP-517 installation failures happening when performing a poetry install
text:
### Description

Started seeing this failure today
```
ChefBuildError
9.193 
9.193   Backend subprocess exited when trying to invoke get_requires_for_build_wheel
9.193   
9.193   Traceback (most recent call last):
9.193     File "/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pyproject_hooks/_in_process/_in_process.py", line 389, in <module>
9.193       main()
9.193     File "/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pyproject_hooks/_in_process/_in_process.py", line 373, in main
9.193       json_out["return_val"] = hook(**hook_input["kwargs"])
9.193                                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
9.193     File "/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pyproject_hooks/_in_process/_in_process.py", line 143, in get_requires_for_build_wheel
9.193       return hook(config_settings)
9.193              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/build_meta.py", line 334, in get_requires_for_build_wheel
9.193       return self._get_build_requires(config_settings, requirements=[])
9.193              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/build_meta.py", line 304, in _get_build_requires
9.193       self.run_setup()
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/build_meta.py", line 522, in run_setup
9.193       super().run_setup(setup_script=setup_script)
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/build_meta.py", line 320, in run_setup
9.193       exec(code, locals())
9.193     File "<string>", line 127, in <module>
9.193     File "<string>", line 89, in run_setup
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 116, in setup
9.193       _install_setup_requires(attrs)
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 87, in _install_setup_requires
9.193       dist.parse_config_files(ignore_option_errors=True)
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/_virtualenv.py", line 22, in parse_config_files
9.193       result = old_parse_config_files(self, *args, **kwargs)
9.193                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 730, in parse_config_files
9.193       self._parse_config_files(filenames=inifiles)
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 599, in _parse_config_files
9.193       opt = self._enforce_underscore(opt, section)
9.193             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
9.193     File "/tmp/tmpeivc7czl/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 629, in _enforce_underscore
9.193       raise InvalidConfigError(
9.193   setuptools.errors.InvalidConfigError: Invalid dash-separated key 'description-file' in 'metadata' (setup.cfg), please use the underscore name 'description_file' instead.
9.193   
9.193 
9.193   at /usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/poetry/installation/chef.py:164 in _prepare
9.196       160│ 
9.196       161│                 error = ChefBuildError("\n\n".join(message_parts))
9.196       162│ 
9.196       163│             if error is not None:
9.196     → 164│                 raise error from None
9.196       165│ 
9.196       166│             return path
9.196       167│ 
9.196       168│     def _prepare_sdist(self, archive: Path, destination: Path | None = None) -> Path:
9.197 
9.197 Note: This error originates from the build backend, and is likely not a problem with poetry but with thrift (0.11.0) not supporting PEP 517 builds. You can verify this by running 'pip wheel --no-cache-dir --use-pep517 "thrift (==0.11.0)"'.
```

Seems to be happening because [setuptools](https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/stable/history.html#v78-0-0) `78.0.0` was released a few hours ago, which added breaking changes

I tried added `setuptools==77.0.3` to the `pyproject.toml` like so
```
[build-system]
requires = ["poetry-core", "setuptools==77.0.3"]
build-backend = "poetry.core.masonry.api"
```
But it doesn't seem to do anything.

### Workarounds

Haven't found a workaround for this so far, maybe have a way to lockdown the version of setuptools which poetry is going to use for installation of packages.

### Poetry Installation Method

pip

### Operating System

MacOS 14.7.4

### Poetry Version

1.8.1

### Poetry Configuration

```bash session
cache-dir = "/Users/USER/Library/Caches/pypoetry"
experimental.system-git-client = false

installer.no-binary = null

solver.lazy-wheel = true

virtualenvs.options.always-copy = false
virtualenvs.options.no-pip = false
virtualenvs.options.no-setuptools = false
virtualenvs.options.system-site-packages = false
virtualenvs.path = "{cache-dir}/virtualenvs"  # /Users/USER/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs
virtualenvs.prefer-active-python = true
virtualenvs.prompt = "{project_name}-py{python_version}"
warnings.export = true
```

  ```
  Paste the output of 'python -m sysconfig', over this line.
  ```
</details>

events.author: toby-coleman
events.comment: See https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/4910 - it would be useful to know what the best workaround is to pin `setuptools` in a poetry environment. Things should go back to normal once https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/4911 is merged/released.

events.author: raffclar
events.comment:
We're also affected. We're working around by installing libraries using pip before poetry within our Dockerfiles:

```dockerfile
RUN poetry run pip install *library_name*==0.2.2
RUN poetry install --no-interaction
```

events.author: toby-coleman
events.comment: It has highlighted to us that even though we pin all our dependency version and our pip/poetry versions we can still get affected by a change to setuptools.

events.author: aaronmarkey
events.comment: This is a known issue, [commented previously](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/4511#issuecomment-1540214656), which the Poetry team has consistently ignored.

events.author: dimbleby
events.comment: Not a poetry bug, please close

events.author: kylejcaron
events.comment:
> This is a known issue, [commented previously](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/4511#issuecomment-1540214656), which the Poetry team has consistently ignored.

This issue should really be re-opened.

Here's an example of how easy it was to fix the setuptools disaster with uv

```
[tool.uv]
# Workaround for https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/4910
build-constraint-dependencies = ["setuptools==77.0.3"]
```

events.author: dimbleby
events.comment:
> This issue should really be re-opened.

Not necessary, since it is duplicated by #8261 (among others)

creator: jvmdc
title: `Poetry install` in fresh project always results in timestamp-based pyc file for `virtualenv`
text:
### Description

I am attempting to setup fully reproducible builds in Docker, i.e. generating layers that are byte-identical every time they are run. 

When the env. variable `SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH` is set, Python's invalidation-mode for compilation is set to checked-hash (per https://docs.python.org/3/library/compileall.html#cmdoption-compileall-invalidation-mode), ensuring deterministic pyc files (Per https://peps.python.org/pep-0552/).

This itself works fine for all the dependencies of the Python project that are installed using `poetry install --compile`, but the virtualenv pyc file that is generated when the virtual environment is first set up is non-deterministic which thens up rendering that layer non-deterministic.

To reproduce the issue, run `docker build` targeting the below Dockerfile. The build will fail if the generated virtualenv.<python version>.pyc is timestamp-based and suceed otherwise:
```
FROM python:3.13.2-bookworm

WORKDIR /app

# Force deterministic pycs (see https://peps.python.org/pep-0552/ and https://docs.python.org/3/library/compileall.html#cmdoption-compileall-invalidation-mode)
ENV SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH=1

RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | POETRY_VERSION=2.1.1 python3 -

ENV PATH="${PATH}:/root/.local/bin"

ENV POETRY_VIRTUALENVS_IN_PROJECT=true

# Setup clean project
RUN poetry new poetry-demo

WORKDIR /app/poetry-demo
# Run poetry install to force generation of virtualenv
RUN poetry install

# Output bytes 5-8 of the pyc file for virtualenv (the pyc header bit field per https://peps.python.org/pep-0552/#specification)
# If determinstic pycs are enabled, they should not be all zeroes
RUN od -tx1 -j4 -N4 -An -w4 .venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/__pycache__/_virtualenv.cpython-313.pyc > bytes.txt
RUN cat bytes.txt

# Fail the build if the bytes are all zeroes as this means the pyc was timestamp-based
RUN grep -q "00 00 00 00" bytes.txt && echo "pyc header bit field is all zeroes, timestamp-based pyc was compiled!" && exit 1 || exit 0


# If `docker build .` fails, it means the pyc file was not deterministic
# If `docker build .` succeeds, it means the pyc file was deterministin
```



### Workarounds

Creating the virtual environment manually before running any Poetry commands that might initialize the virtual environment using `python -m venv` 

### Poetry Installation Method

install.python-poetry.org

### Operating System

Debian Bookworm

### Poetry Version

Poetry (version 2.1.1)

### Poetry Configuration

```bash session
cache-dir = "/root/.cache/pypoetry"
data-dir = "/root/.local/share/pypoetry"
installer.max-workers = null
installer.no-binary = null
installer.only-binary = null
installer.parallel = true
installer.re-resolve = true
keyring.enabled = true
python.installation-dir = "{data-dir}/python"  # /root/.local/share/pypoetry/python
requests.max-retries = 0
solver.lazy-wheel = true
system-git-client = false
virtualenvs.create = true
virtualenvs.in-project = true
virtualenvs.options.always-copy = false
virtualenvs.options.no-pip = false
virtualenvs.options.system-site-packages = false
virtualenvs.path = "{cache-dir}/virtualenvs"  # /root/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs
virtualenvs.prompt = "{project_name}-py{python_version}"
virtualenvs.use-poetry-python = false
```

creator: brentropic
title: Poetry Core: `parse_constraint` can create unparseable max for SingleMarker
text:
### Description

A Python module with `Requires-Python: ==3.*,>=3.8.0` is in my lock-space.

Running `poetry lock` gives me the following message and quits instead of producing a lockfile:
`Invalid marker for 'python_full_version': <4.dev0`

Minimum repro:
```py
from poetry.core.constraints.version.parser import parse_constraint
constraint = parse_constraint("==3.*,>=3.8.0")
from poetry.core.version.markers import SingleMarker
SingleMarker("python_full_version", constraint.min)
SingleMarker("python_full_version", constraint.max)
```
```
poetry.core.constraints.version.exceptions.ParseConstraintError: Could not parse version constraint: 4.dev0.0
...
poetry.core.version.markers.InvalidMarkerError: Invalid marker for 'python_full_version': 4.dev0
```

### Workarounds

Commenting out the following in `poetry.core.constraints.version.parser._make_x_constraint_range`:

https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry-core/blob/2.1.1/src/poetry/core/constraints/version/parser.py#L248-L251

```py
    if not is_marker_constraint:
        _min = _min.first_devrelease()
        if not _max.is_devrelease():
            _max = _max.first_devrelease()
```

Not much of a workaround really.

### Poetry Installation Method

pipx

### Operating System

--

### Poetry Version

Poetry (version 2.1.1)

```bash session
--
```

events.author: brentropic
events.comment:
Looks like the issue doesn't occur in 2.0.1, but it does occur in 2.1.0.

I hope that helps.

events.author: brentropic
events.comment:
Looks like commenting this out resolves the issue:

```py
            elif name == "python_full_version" and not swapped_name_value:
                # fix precision of python_full_version marker
                precision = self._value.count(".") + 1
                if precision < 3:
                    suffix = ".0" * (3 - precision)
                    self._value += suffix
                    constraint_string += suffix
```

https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry-core/blame/2.1.0/src/poetry/core/version/markers.py#L419-L425

Makes sense now, this code will convert `4.dev0` to `4.dev0.0`, which isn't a valid version.

@radoering  
What is the alternative solution to this? Passing it through the full Version parser and normalising it?

events.author: radoering
events.comment:
I think I need the call stack of the original error to give an answer.

Can you provide the output of `poetry lock -v`, especially the traceback? (Or even better a small `pyproject.toml` to reproduce the issue?)

creator: Evan0000000000
title: Suggestion for different naming of virtual env in non-package mode
text:
### Issue Kind

Change in current behaviour

### Description

Currently with `non-package-mode = false` when  poetry creates the virtual environment it seems like the folder name for the venv is something like:
"non-package-mode-{pseudo random string}-{python version}"
e.g.,
"non-package-mode-WCWsJ_DC-py3.11"

I'm curious if there's a technical reason for that particular string being used--obviously there's not necessarily a project name as poetry would otherwise use in pyproject.toml , but compared to e.g., using the last element of the path the project is in I could see it causing some confusion in a case like this:

- I have several paths each using poetry in NPM to fiddle with different things
- I activate one, prepending some variation on "non-package-mode-some_string-py3.11" to my prompt
- I navigate away from the path the virtual env is relevant to
- it's no longer apparent which of my couple of experimental envs are active (since they would all prepend non-package-mode-py3.11) somewhat removing the utility of modifying the prompt

### Impact

I imagine this causing some amount of confusion with developers who have multiple terminals open or work on several things at once.

### Workarounds

I assume the activation script could be modified manually for each virtual env should this be a pressing issue for anyone

events.author: dimbleby
events.comment:
"the last element of a path" is also not unique.

suggest naming your projects
